title: Valentine's Day Beauty Shoot Tutorial
summary: Lindsay Adler demonstrates a creative workflow for a Valentine's Day themed beauty photoshoot, detailing set design with reflections, a three-light setup using optical spots and bounce flash, in-camera effects with filters, and color grading techniques in Capture One.

steps.action: Set up the background using a coral-colored seamless paper to match the theme.
Place a rose gold mirrored plexiglass sheet on a posing table to create reflections and anchor the subject.
Set up the main light using a strobe with an optical spot modifier to create a tight slice of light on the subject's face.
Set up a second strobe as a background light using an optical spot with a heart-shaped gobo to project a pattern behind the subject.
Add a third strobe with no modifier, pointed at the wall and ceiling behind the camera, to create omnidirectional bounce fill light and lift shadows.
Attach a star filter to the camera lens to create starburst effects on the specular highlights and reflections.
Apply color grading in Capture One: warm up white balance, adjust tint to magenta, desaturate slightly, add contrast, and use color wheels to shift highlights (cyan/green) and shadows (magenta).
Hold a reflective wand from an expansion pack in front of the lens to create foreground reflections and visual interest.

key_takeaways: Use optical spots to create precise shapes and slices of light for dramatic effect.
Bounce a bare strobe off the back wall/ceiling to create a soft, omnidirectional fill that lifts shadows without adding directional distractions.
Incorporate physical props like mirrored plexiglass and lens filters to add layers of visual interest and reflections in-camera.
Use color grading (specifically split toning highlights and shadows) to reinforce the mood and theme of the shoot.
